answers.answer: Newcomers can find information on how to manage in a new city and identify who can help them upon arrival in Cluj-Napoca.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Key contact points include the Immigration Service for Cluj County, the Emergency call number 112, and the National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: The program offers support for accommodation, meals, and integration specifically in Cluj-Napoca.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Cluj-Napoca'.

answers.answer: One can access the application for the accommodation, meals, and integration support program by clicking the 'Access the application' link provided on the page.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Cluj-Napoca'.

answers.answer: People arriving in Cluj-Napoca can contact the Clinical Emergency Hospital in Napoca Cluj for medical services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: The provided information states that a list of family doctors can be found in Oradea.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: The International Organization for Migration (IOM) and World Vision Romania both provide psychological support services.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: Psychological support is available in Russian, Ukrainian, Romanian, and English languages through IOM, and in Russian and Ukrainian through World Vision Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: The Sensiblu Foundation offers social counseling, face-to-face or online psychotherapy, legal advice and representation in court, a support network for women and girls, obtaining forensic medical certificates, and referral to mediation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The 'Ukrainian Home - Protection and Support Center' implements a comprehensive program for protection, information, well-being, inclusiveness, psychosocial support, assistance with injuries, and providing verified information.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: All refugees from Ukraine are eligible for support from the 'Ukrainian Home - Protection and Support Center'.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: Newcomers can use the public transportation system for free in Cluj-Napoca.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Transport'.

answers.answer: To use public transportation for free in Cluj-Napoca, you will need to show an ID in case of a check.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Transport'.

answers.answer: Resources for finding housing information are available under the 'Housing Info' section, which can be accessed by clicking its link.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Housing Info'.

answers.answer: Support for job seekers is available, and more information can be found by accessing the 'Jobs Support' section.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Jobs Support'.

answers.answer: The Women's Center provides support in accessing reproductive health services, navigating the health system, and offers services dedicated to victims of domestic violence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: People living with HIV can receive free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social services from specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers in Romania and through the expertise of Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.

answers.answer: Free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social HIV services are available through specialist doctors from 10 Regional HIV Centers in Romania and with the support of Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-cluj-napoca and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.
